meaningMnemonic:
As the <kanji>years</kanji> get <kanji>distribute</kanji>d, you slowly turn into an <vocabulary>elderly</vocabulary> <vocabulary>senior</vocabulary>, proud of your <vocabulary>old age</vocabulary>.

This word is used to politely describe an elderly person, as in 年配の方 or 年配者.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The はい goes to a ぱい, because… elderly persons love <reading>pie</reading> (ぱい), right?
